column4: hi guys, i have a usb-stick which i want to mount on ubuntu > what was the cmd again? mount vfat ?
mount: mount point /media/sdc1 does not exist
the cmd i ran was > sudo /dev/sdc1 /media/sdc1
after that, google mount usb fstab   - there is good info in there, to edit the fstab and make life happier.
it's ok that it is fat
another error: "mount: special device /dev/sdc1 does not exist"
sudo mkdir /media/sdc1   >>> creates the folder sdc1 in /media... the sudo mount /dev/sdc1 /media/sdc1
that means your usb key has nothing on it.
why the error when trying to mount?
after that, google mount usb fstab   - there is good info in there, to edit the fstab and make life happier.
